etymologies: early 16th century; earliest use found in Rede Me and be nott Wrothe. From either question or question + -ist

definitions: A (habitual or systematic) questioner, specifically in theological matters.

notes.text: In early use applied to certain Scholastic philosophers, such as Aquinas and Duns Scotus.

definitions: At the universities of Cambridge and Harvard: an undergraduate in the last term before final examinations.
